product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: My husband says the jacket is lightweight yet very warm.  He loves it.  It does not loose goose down all over his outfit which is another plus!

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: Lightweight, but keeps me very warm.  Not giving it 5 stars because it loses more feathers than I anticipated.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: Feathers tend to shed more than another brand jacket we have but good.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: Fits great and I have gotten tons of compliments on the coat.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: Lightweight but comfortable for mild winter weather.  I wouldn't recommend it for anything more severe than late fall or early spring though in New York State.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: I mostly use this jacket under a "shell jacket" -- as an insulation layer.  It has a light feel, and under the shell, provides comfort in the 20s.  For the sale price I paid, it has been a high rate of return product so far.  I'm 6'1" 170 lbs -- sleeve length and overall fit is excellent.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: Absolutely love this jacket. This guy is so light weight, i hardly even realize its on. I'm a pretty athletic individual, as such, i have a high metabolism and i do not need a giant coat for most weather so for me personally, it keeps me warm in weather as low as 30-40 degrees (i'm from texas, our winters don't get much worse than that).Can't speak to other individual's uses, but i love it.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: Great product.  Could be a little warmer though for Chicago winters.  I have used it a lot so far as a layer along with either a fleece vest or used with an outer shell.  Like all packable puffy down jackets it is super lightweight.  When you first unpack the jacket it is really flat and doesn't look too great.  After wearing it one or two times it fluffs up nicely.  I bought another one in blue for my son as well.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: Nice warm lightweight travel jacket but the feathers do come out a little too much.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: Great jacket that is soft and warm. Sometimes the filling will come out and show on dark clothing underneath.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: My husband loves that he can pack it in its own pocket. The jacket is perfect for travel and backpacking.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: Functionally this jacket is awesome. Definitely my favorite jacket as it is soooo light and thin.  The self packing feature is convenient. Can't wait to try this out when camping. I've worn it in winter in Spokane and Colorado Springs. It is so comfortable it makes me wonder if there are gloves that have down in them because I have big thick gloves that keep you warm but give you hot dog fingers. I do have tiny bits of down come out every once in a while but it will take years and years before that will affect performance. I personally don't like the puffy jacket look but I don't care anymore because it is so comfortable. I got a medium and I usually wear large for t-shirts.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: This jacket fits well, but it isn´t thermal like the say. I bought it for winter season but it doesnt serve.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: I purchased the jacket for use as a medium layer to be worn under a heavier outer garment during very cold days.  In that role it functions very well.  The jacket is extremely light, but adds a good layer of warmth.  I'll probably use the jacket by itself during the spring or fall, as it fits my 5' 11" 160 lb frame well, and is stylish in it's own right.  I only gave it four stars as the price seemed a little out of line.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: Bought it for a nephew. He is very happy as this is the style he was looking for.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: It is not keeping me quite as warm as I had hoped but still warm enough and warmer than my other coats. A very good coat for its cost which is why I gave it 4 stars instead of 3.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: It is suitable, clothing is very light, a good choice. My husband is very satisfied with the down jacket.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: My husband loves this jacket. It's warm, packs up small, and doesn't take up much space in a suitcase which is nice when traveling from one climate to another.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: Very little material but did its job, very warm - used it for everest base camp trek dec 2014 and it was one of the most warmest and lightest equipment I had. It protects against the cold very well and stuffs within its own left pocket for very good storage. Never appreciated how great down was before I used this jacket.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: nice job,it's very goodlooking when you dressed it.so soft and comfortable.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: It is very thin and is just what my son needed.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: I am very pleased with this jacket. It weighs about nothing, it compresses down into a small carry bag, takes virtually no room to store and was more than adequate on my 14,000 + elevation in 15 mph winds at @ 40 degrees and again at 10,000 + ft @ +/- 30 degrees. Excellent addition to my pack! Highly recommended for anyone for 3 season camping.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: Fits good , ordered as recommend on page. Sleeves are somewhat large and the elastic at the bottom is loose. I did use while in the mountains and it maintained the warmth. I would buy it again.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: just what I need to pack for camping trip. use it at night around the campfire

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: Size:  5 stars for size.  A lot of reviews that said it was somewhat large for their size almost tempted me to get a large instead of an extra large.  Man I'm glad I didn't listen, because this thing fits me like I expect an extra large to fit me.  Not too tight, but not like wearing a 50 gallon garbage sack either.  I am 6'-1", 212 lbs with a muscular build, and it fits perfectly.  I could wear layers under this if I wanted to, but it also feels like I could wear this under a parka shell as the base layer.Quality:  3 stars for quality.  Mainly, they went super chinsy on the amount of down in each chamber.  I don't care too much because this is simply a warm, extra-light layer for backpacking in my case, but I can't see this keeping you too warm if the weather got down into the freezing range.  I know this jacket was only $70 compared to most other jackets which are well over $150.  But even for $70 you'd think they could stuff a bit more down into the chambers because it's not puffy in the slightest.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: Weatherproof is not rain proof more like spong Bob... No rain just cold you be will be styling Warm...

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: Love it.  Just got back from a section hike on the Appalachian Trail.  I thru hiked several years ago and wish I had this with me.  The cuffs are a little large.  The jacket does get rips/burns easily so if I am around a campfire or in briars I throw a light windbreaker over it.  I will be getting a few more of these. Very warm, lightweight and packs down to a small size.  You can't beat the price.   Also, if you get a rip/burn just use tenacious tape on it.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: I love the coat.  It is warm and it is light.  But it is waaay to small.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: The down jacket does not have enough down and it did not keep me warm I returned it.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: It is like the little engine that could.  It is thin and light, but does quite well in keeping you warm and it is compact (folds into a pouch (travel pillow)) to boot.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: Exactly as described, a warm,  light weight, very packable down shirt, jacket, or sweater alternative.  This is not represented as a winter coat replacement; but as a spring/fall weight  jacket, or a mid layer; it is perfect.  The product I received is well made (seams are uniform and well sewn).  I wore the sweater/shirt about 5 times the week I received it and did not experience any down poking through the nylon material or seams.  This has become my go-to alternative to a sweater or as a mid-layer under a heavier coat when it is really frigid outside.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: Material is very thin, very fit, not suitable for cold weather.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: It fits very well, but there are a lot of  threads hanging from the jacket.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: I've owned the coat for about a week, temps in Chicago have been as low as zero.Jacket is very lightweight yet warm.Look great dressed up or very casual.I find it very comfortable as well.I bought a medium, hoping to keep the look slim and it fits perfectly. Layers well with a shirt & sweater, similar to the picture.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: Is really good a littl bit long on the sleeves im 6ft and 185 lbs medium is really good.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: Great quality and it is really great looking. Very sharp. Lightweight but warm enough for  DC winters.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: Great jacket! Fits as expected and looks great. I have worn it in 30 degree weather up to 60 degrees and was neither too cold or warm. Highly recommended for areas that don't get too cold. I have also washed it several times and the stitches have held up.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: Very light yet works well in breezy and light cooling.  Going to Denmark with me soon.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: Great jacket for the price. I don't love the elastic waist and cuffs but they are as good as any other high end brand name jacket.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Lightweight Water and Wind-Resistant Puffer Vest
review_body: Very snug fit, but warm.  The zipper is too light weight for my liking.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Lightweight Water and Wind-Resistant Puffer Vest
review_body: Somewhat larger than I expected. It was too long, but very comfortable and warm.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Lightweight Water and Wind-Resistant Puffer Vest
review_body: This is a fantastic vest.I bought it for my husband, for our trip to Italy. It's light weight andSoft. Didn't want something heavy , to weigh him down on our travels. And the price is right.bought one for my self . The female version. A must buy item. The only reason this item didn't get 5stars the zipper should be heavier. But over all a good vest.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Lightweight Water and Wind-Resistant Puffer Vest
review_body: Product was nicely made but I ordered an XL which was smaller than expected.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Lightweight Water and Wind-Resistant Puffer Vest
review_body: Light weight and fits well, I'm tall so I had a hard time finding one that wasn't to  short. it's what I wanted.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Lightweight Water and Wind-Resistant Puffer Vest
review_body: I am thrilled with the softness and quality of this product. So many times a puffy vest will be awkward and feel very stiff. This one is so soft and looks very dressy. A+

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Lightweight Water and Wind-Resistant Puffer Vest
review_body: Pretty sure I saw something nicer at Walgreens for $6. Feels cheep and there's basically no filling in this thing to keep you warm. Fits good around the torso but a bit longer than expected. Not bad though.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Lightweight Water and Wind-Resistant Puffer Vest
review_body: The pocket zippers aren't great, but the product has a great length

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: Nice pack able jacket.  Not for extreme cold weather.  Very inexpensive

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: A great fall-winter coat, depending on where you live. I live in Boston, so this coat is a little thin for those bitter winter days, however it is so lightweight and comfortable that I even dare wear it through blizzards. Definitely as warm as a North Face jacket, though perhaps not as much as one of those thick puffer coats that turn you into a marshmallow.I was actually surprised at how warm it was, because it is incredibly thin. When I first tried it on, I was nervous that this would be a bad buy as the jacket itself is almost paper thin, though afterwards I found myself sweating in minutes.Warm, thin, light, a great coat. Definitely packable too, though a bag wasn't included.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: This jacket or coat  has become a favorite of mine, I've had it for a few months. Intially,  I thought because it was so thin, that I could only wear it in maybe mid 30 or 40 degrees weather, but today it truly passed the test in 10 degree weather with me wearing just a light sweater and a Tshirt;  now the wind chill factor wasn't bad today, but it was frigid cold outside.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Lightweight Water and Wind-Resistant Puffer Vest
review_body: It's light and keeps one warm. I like it and would recommend it.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Lightweight Water and Wind-Resistant Puffer Vest
review_body: Fits tall and skinny. I am 6'4 195 and it fits well. Tight around the waist as other reviews would indicate but wearable. Great value for the price!

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Lightweight Water and Wind-Resistant Puffer Vest
review_body: Fits a little large, but is very, very warm. As reference I'm 6 foot, 205 lbs, 42 inch chest. Shrugs off the elements and since I got it on sale for ~$35 I have zero complaints for what I paid for.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Lightweight Water and Wind-Resistant Puffer Vest
review_body: like it ok but the fit for the large is too snug, probably need to lose 10 pounds

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Lightweight Water and Wind-Resistant Puffer Vest
review_body: Really well made vest, very warm. I'm 6 foot exactly and a large goes down below my waist line just a little too far. Not worth sending back though, good vest

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Lightweight Water and Wind-Resistant Puffer Vest
review_body: Nice long, light weight vest for $22.50 except the zipper constantly pulls loose at the bottom and it is a major struggle to get the zipper un-jammed and open. Bend over or sit down and the zipper pulls apart at the bottom leaving you stuck in the vest until you pull it over your head or manage to work the zipper free.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Lightweight Water and Wind-Resistant Puffer Vest
review_body: Purchased this vest for husband to wear over his flannel shirts while hiking and running errands.  He is 6' tall and weighs 195 and the large fits him perfectly.  He likes it because it's not real puffy yet keeps him warm enough.  Great vest at a great price.

product_title: Dickies Men's Water Resistant Diamond Quilted Nylon Jacket
review_body: NICE, LIGHT WEIGHT BUT WARM.  NOT TOO BULKIE TO WORK IN .

product_title: Dickies Men's Water Resistant Diamond Quilted Nylon Jacket
review_body: My husband says this jacket is one of the warmest jackets he has ever owned yet it is light weight and not bulky. He can wear it alone or under his wool shirt jacket. He thinks it's great! (And I loved the price)

product_title: Dickies Men's Water Resistant Diamond Quilted Nylon Jacket
review_body: A good overall casual alternative for a sweater. Inside lining is comfy & insulated well. Keeps wind & chill out. Also can be used with Dickies Eisenhower jacket during colder weather. Good buy & investment. Also packs flat for travel.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: Mom son loves his jacket.  It's comfortable and hip and can be layered on colder days and packed away to nothing on hotter days

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: I initially bought the pack able vest in a men's medium for my brother. It fit him in almost every way except for the waist. He has broad shoulders but slimmer waist, so it was very loose and airy. I then bought him the jacket (also in Medium) to see if it would fit better, but it had the same problem, so I returned both the vest and jacket.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: Haven't got to really use yet. Tried it on a couple of cool mornings and kept me toasty. Although I wouldn't suggest it for someone over 5' 8" or with a ample belly. It packs away in its own pocket about the size of couple of fits. Could be compressed a little more in a compression sack.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: When I opened the box, I was surprised.Is not an ordinary thin.I think the clothes can not wear in winter.In addition, the medial surface of the work is not so good.

product_title: Hawke & Co Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket II
review_body: Got it for my boyfriend. He absolutely adores the light-weight and the softness of this jacket :) Thank you for putting a smile on his face!

product_title: Lanbaosi Women's Lightweight Jacket UV Protect+Quick Dry Windproof Skin Coat
review_body: Pretty good jacket for the price.Pro: packs down to a very small size so it's easy to carry.Con: thin and the hood is very small.

product_title: Lanbaosi Women's Lightweight Jacket UV Protect+Quick Dry Windproof Skin Coat
review_body: It is just what I was looking for - light, and easy to pick, and fits well.

product_title: Lanbaosi Women's Lightweight Jacket UV Protect+Quick Dry Windproof Skin Coat
review_body: Got me through 2 weeks in Ireland.  Is super lightweight, packs down to nothing (easily fits in a purse) and kept me dry.  The only thing I would caution is that the zippers tend to catch on the fabric, especially the pockets, so use them minimally or prepare for a few snags.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: Clothes do manual work is very poor，Sleeve, zipper, can find a long thread。Small details are not deal with, let alone other work, is not satisfied with the shopping at a time

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: The jacket packs small and is a warm jacket that is very light.  The quality is VERY POOR.  Out of the bag, there were already loose threads and these are only going to continue to unravel.  The first jacket I got had broken zippers on both pockets.  If I had to pay full price, I would be pretty upset; I am only slightly upset since I got this as a prime deal,  and I was able to exchange it.  It is cheap enough to keep as convenient jacket.

product_title: 32Degrees Weatherproof Men's Packable Down Puffer Jacket
review_body: can't you finish the jacket tidily? too many torn threads left

product_title: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
review_body: I feel just good. It is water resistant and I tested it for some times, really good.

product_title: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
review_body: Nice quality and style. Purchased another one in another color almost immediately

product_title: Charles River Apparel Men's Pack-N-Go Windbreaker Pullover
review_body: Just what I expected when seeking a pullover jacket thanksAmazon.com

product_title: Condor Men's Summit Soft Shell Tactical Jacket
review_body: A little bulky but it still was tight enough to not cause excessive baggyness

product_title: Columbia Men's Cathedral Peak Front-Zip Fleece Vest
review_body: Nice jacket. Fits nicely. Very good for light winter or spring weather.

product_title: Columbia Men's Ballistic III Windproof Fleece Jacket
review_body: very comfy as a lightweight jacket for chilly days when a heavier coat isn't needed. I use it in my office all the time when coworkers have the air conditioning turned down. It's a great jacket. The fit is a little loose, which is just what I was looking for.

product_title: Columbia Men's Ballistic III Windproof Fleece Jacket
review_body: this fleece is awesome ! it's got a mild "neoprene" feel to it, but it's softer and thinner than many like it, and it is TOASTY warm compared to my "normal" fleeces and really IS windproof.  it's much thicker and tougher in texture than a normal fleece though, and feels more like I'm wearing a jacket, than just a fleece. it's pretty bulky to pack, so it's not likely to get shoved into a backpack as a last minute afterthought, but it IS likely to be the first "jacket" i grab when I load that backpack into the truck.

product_title: Columbia Men's Ballistic III Windproof Fleece Jacket
review_body: This was a present for my husband and he loved it.  It is light weight but very warm, exactly the combination he was looking for.

product_title: Woolrich Men's Arctic Parka
review_body: It's little bulky. But warm and well made. Fits good for suit also.

product_title: Carhartt Men's Sherpa Lined Sandstone Hooded Multi Pocket Jacket J284
review_body: warm enough to wear when working outside even when doing a little movement or working hard.  great fit, keeps the wind off just what I was looking for.

product_title: Women's Commuter Jacket EcoRepel All Weather Windbreaker Raincoat
review_body: Very good quality. Lightweight and soft. Came nicely packed, on time.

product_title: Columbia Men's Glennaker Lake Front-Zip Rain Jacket with Hideaway Hood
review_body: Its good for a very thin windbreaker. Was a tiny bit loose.

product_title: Columbia Men's Glennaker Lake Front-Zip Rain Jacket with Hideaway Hood
review_body: Lightweight rain jacket that has a thin mesh lining for comfort. My husband is very satisfied with the fit, comfort, and quality of this jacket.

product_title: Condor Men's Summit Soft Shell Tactical Jacket
review_body: This softshell is a great lightweight jacket. It fits true to size. the micro fleece lining makes it comfortable. A great deal.

product_title: Carhartt Men's Arctic Quilt Lined Yukon Active Jacket J133
review_body: perfect winter coat for when you don't need the snow suit, but still spending time outdoors.

product_title: Columbia Women's Switchback II Jacket
review_body: Very light weight, easy to throw in a backpack good quality

product_title: Alternative Men's Eco Zip Hoodie Sweatshirt
review_body: Perfect lightweight hoodie for those days that start chilly and end warmer.

product_title: Dickies Men's Snap-Front Nylon Jacket
review_body: Perfect for working, not bulky but will keep you warm and keeps the rain out.

product_title: The North Face Women's Resolve Jacket
review_body: I love this jacket! It's light weight but feels comfy to wear - all while blocking the wind and rain.

product_title: Columbia Men's Steens Mountain Front-Zip Fleece Jacket
review_body: Great way to keep the chill away. The materials are comfortable enough, and it doesn't feel heavy at all

product_title: London Fog Men's Zip-Front Golf Jacket
review_body: Bought this as Christmas present for husband. Nice lightweight jacket. He loves the inside pockets.

product_title: Columbia Men's Glennaker Lake Front-Zip Rain Jacket with Hideaway Hood
review_body: Great jacket , needs to be more breathable . Still haven't figured out how to fold it up in the pocket . 4 stars for it not being breathable enough.

product_title: Utopia Wear Men's Outdoor Full Zip Fleece Jacket (Black)
review_body: This is a very soft light jacket that is perfect for when it's not too cold out. It looks very nice and is not scratchy at all. The wrist band are very comfortable and the zipper functions very well. This is light enough to fit into a backpack and have just in case it gets cold. So far is has been the perfect spring jacket for my husband. I think it would also work well under a winter shell type jacket, my husband has a work jacket that is like a thicker wind breaker but doesn't tend to be very warm, so combined I think it would make a great pair for winter when it's sometimes really cold and sometimes not, I received this product at a discount for my honest review, I was not compensated in any way.

product_title: Duofold Men's Mid-Weight Moisture-Wicking Ankle-Length Layering Pant
review_body: Light weight and very comfortableperfect under jeans on a cold day

product_title: London Fog Men's Zip-Front Golf Jacket
review_body: a light and very comfortable jacket....just what I was looking for

product_title: Hanes Men's Full-Zip EcoSmart Fleece Hoodie
review_body: Nice fitting jacket. Just heavy enough to keep you warm yet mobile.

product_title: Alternative Men's Rocky Zip Hoodie Sweatshirt
review_body: Fits very well, looks cool, quite warm although light and not thick.

product_title: Dickies Men's Snap-Front Nylon Jacket
review_body: Sick wind breaker to cruise around town on and skate in the fall

product_title: Champion Men's Full-zip Eco Fleece Hoodie Jacket
review_body: Perfect jacket for the ups and downs of a Michigan Spring. Well made too.
